snippet: A corporate tax holiday was disastrous in 2005. It would be disastrous again.
abstract: Editorial argues that while financial situation of the Highway Trust Fund is dire, proposal to shore up its finances through a corporate tax holiday would be just as disastrous as it was in 2005; argues that holiday is not only ineffective, but grossly unfair to companies that do not have a foreign presence; suggests alternative methods for replenishing fund and for taxing foreign-held corporate profits.
lead_paragraph: A corporate tax holiday was disastrous in 2005. It would be disastrous again.

headline.seo: Corporate Tax Holiday Won’t Cure Highway Fund Woes
headline.main: Highways Need Help, but Not This Way
headline.print_headline: Highways Need Help, but Not This Way
